task.title: Reorganize and clean up repository documentation under docs/

steps.summary: Examine documentation in docs/ and clean it up and organize it better.
Reviewed existing docs/ files; found mixed audiences (guides, reference, architecture notes, blog posts, UI artifacts) all in one flat folder, plus some outdated Tailwind guidance in reference docs.

Adopted a directory-based docs taxonomy: guides/ (how-to), reference/ (contracts/patterns), architecture/ (proposals/notes), plans/ (app specs), ui/ (mockups/ui-kit), blog/ (historical writeups). Rationale: improves discoverability and reduces churn from mixing long-form posts with operational docs.
Moved docs into the new structure using git mv; fixed an accidental double-nested mockups folder; added docs/README.md index; updated cross-links and README/script references to the new paths.

Cleaned up reference docs to match the current UI contract: removed Tailwind-centric sections from reference/patterns.md and updated reference/llm-prompts.md to explicitly enforce the UI contract and custom.css-only class usage.
Validated that old doc paths were eliminated by searching for stale references (rg for docs/<oldfile>.md) and verifying the new docs tree.

Files added/changed: docs/README.md; updated README.md + scripts/deploy.sh for new doc links; moved docs into docs/{guides,reference,architecture,plans,ui,blog}/; edited docs/reference/{patterns.md,llm-prompts.md} for UI-contract alignment.

evaluations.notes: No code changes; documentation link integrity checked via ripgrep searches for old paths.

final_summary: Reorganized docs/ into purpose-based subfolders, added a docs index (docs/README.md), updated all internal/external references, and removed outdated Tailwind guidance from reference docs in favor of the current UI contract (custom.css-only).
